trans-unit.source: Provides an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> for the child elements in the visual tree.
AdornerDecorator can contain only one child element.
That element can contain multiple elements that can be adorned.
The AdornerDecorator specifies the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer> in the visual tree.
It is typically used in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> for a control that might host <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Adorner> objects.
For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Window> contains an AdornerDecorator so that the child elements of the window can be adorned.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer.GetAdornerLayer%2A> method returns `null` if you pass in an element that does not have an AdornerDecorator as an ancestor in its visual tree.
For more information about adorners and visual trees, see [Adorners Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [Trees in WPF](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> associated with this adorner decorator.
Positions child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ArrangeOverride%2A>.
The size reserved for this element by its parent.
The actual size needed by the element.
This return value is typically the same as the value passed to *finalSize*.
Gets or sets the single child of an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
An <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> can contain only one child, which is the parent element for the visual tree below the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator>.
The single child of an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a child at the specified index position.
The index position of the wanted <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child of the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref> element.
Measures the size required for child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.MeasureOverride%2A>.
A size to constrain the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref> to.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> object representing the amount of layout space needed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.
Gets the number of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects in this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref>.

Either returns `2` (one for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> and one for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator.Child*>) or the property returns `0` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator"></xref> has no child.
